newsitem.title: FRANCE: TENNIS-BECKER BECOMES FIFTH SEED TO CRASH OUT.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-BECKER BECOMES FIFTH SEED TO CRASH OUT.

text.p: Three times champion Boris Becker became the fifth seed to crash out of the Paris Open at the first hurdle when he lost 6-3 5-7 6-4 to Spaniard Carlos Moya in the second round on Wednesday.

The sixth seed, who won the Stuttgart Open on Sunday and was expected to go a long way at Bercy, saved two match points -- the second when the umpire overruled a line call that favoured Moya -- before succumbing after an hour and 55 minutes in his first meeting with the 20-year-old Spaniard.
The defeat could jeopardise Becker's chances of defending his ATP Tour World Championship title in Hanover next month.

The German world number three, who would have clinched his spot if he had reached the Paris semifinals, is currently sixth in the qualifying places for the eight-man year-end event with several players vying for the three places still not settled.
Fifth seeded Croat Goran Ivanisevic became the fourth seed to crash out in Wednesday's opening match, 6-3 6-2 to Dutchman Paul Haarhuis.
Andre Agassi, Richard Krajicek and Jim Courier all lost on Tuesday.
